DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : The incidence non-fatal myocardial infarction Swedish woman age 60 increase past 20 year . Standard risk factor change include decrease average systolic blood pressure S-cholesterol moderate increase smoking diabetes prevalence . During time period Swedish woman 'moved ' labor market , employment rate similar Swedish men woman . However , woman keep main responsibility household child care . In spite generous legislation maternity leave child care , strain multiple role responsibilities probably increased Swedish woman . The study seek provide answer : 1 ) factor - biological behavioral - influenced extent progress coronary artery disease , 2 ) physiological , biochemical , neuroendocrine mechanism participate process . In addition conventional statistical method , canonical correlation analysis use describe direct indirect pathways pathogenesis . Furthermore , mean two comparison group , information obtain specific characteristic female psychosocial behavioral coronary heart disease risk profile . DESIGN NARRATIVE : The role social strain study within broad psychosocial context include social network , social support , social skill , reciprocity , cop , stressor , chronic work strain , family structure , personality behavior characteristic . These aspect relate possible physiologic cardiovascular mechanism include reactivity persistent elevate heart rate blood pressure ambulatory monitoring well cardiac dysrhythmia silent symptomatic ischemia . Psychoneuroendocrine pathways also investigate . These include catecholamine , cortisol , prolactin , estrogen , testosterone , gastrin , somatostatin . Other biochemical measure include lipid profile , coagulation , thrombolysis immune function .
